meanings.definition: To curse more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outcursed her friend during the argument.
meanings.sent2: He always outcurses his opponents in online games.
meanings.sent3: The witch outcursed the wizard in a magical duel.
meanings.sent4: Her anger outcursed any other emotion in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outcursed the howling wind.

meanings.definition: To have been cursed more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house seemed to have been outcursed by a darker force.
meanings.sent2: He felt like he had been outcursed by misfortune.
meanings.sent3: The old pirate ship looked as if it had been outcursed by a ghostly crew.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned castle appeared to have been outcursed by a tragic history.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse on the tomb had outcursed all attempts to break it.
